edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device
Class Device

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device.Device
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is the main class that stores information about each Xilinx part. It contains a 2D grid of Tiles which contain all the routing and primitive sites necessary for a placer and router.

Author:
Chris Lavin Created on: Apr 22, 2010
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Device getInstance(java.lang.String partName)
This method is intended to only be called by a special method, util.FileTools.loadDevice(). This will either return a populated device of the same part if it already exists in memory as the singleton instance or a new device ready to be populated from a file.

Parameters:
partName - The part name of the device to get.
Returns:
If no device has been loaded or the part names do not match the singleton instance, it returns a new Device, otherwise it will return an existing copy of the device in memory.

isRouteThrough

public boolean isRouteThrough(Wire w)
Checks if this wire is RouteThrough.

Parameters:
w - The wire to test.
Returns:
True if the wire is a routeThrough, false otherwise.

getPrimitiveExternalPin

public java.lang.Integer getPrimitiveExternalPin(Pin pin)
Gets the external wire enumeration on the instance pin.

Parameters:
pin - The pin to get the external name from.
Returns:
The wire enumeration of the internal pin on the instance primitive of pin.

getRouteThrough

public PIPRouteThrough getRouteThrough(Wire w)
Gets the PIPRouteThrough object for a wire.

Parameters:
w - The wire which has a corresponding PIPRouteThrough
Returns:
The PIPRouteThrough or null if it does not exist.

getTile

public Tile getTile(int row,
                    int column)
Gets the current tile in the device based on absolute row and column indices

Parameters:
row - The absolute row index (0 starting at top)
column - The absolute column index (0 starting at the left)
Returns:
The tile specified by row and column, if the indices are out of bounds it returns null

getTile

public Tile getTile(java.lang.String tile)
This will get a Tile by its name using a HashMap.

Parameters:
tile - The name of the tile to get.
Returns:
The tile with the name tile, or null if it does not exist.

getTile

public Tile getTile(int uniqueTileNumber)
Each tile in a device can be referenced by a unique integer which is a combination of its row and column index. This will get and return the tile with the unique index provided.

Parameters:
uniqueTileNumber - The unique tile number of the tile to get.
Returns:
The tile with the uniqueTileNumber, or null if none exists.

getPrimitiveSite

public PrimitiveSite getPrimitiveSite(java.lang.String name)
This gets and returns a primitive site on the device by name.

Parameters:
name - Name of the primitive site to get.
Returns:
The primitive site with the name, or null if none exists.

getCorrespondingPrimitiveSite

public static PrimitiveSite getCorrespondingPrimitiveSite(PrimitiveSite current,
                                                          Tile newSiteTile)
A method to get the corresponding primitive site for current in a different tile. For example in a Virtex 4, there are 4 slices in a CLB tile, when moving a hard macro the current slice must go in the same spot in a new CLB tile

Parameters:
current - The current primitive site of the instance.
newSiteTile - The tile of the new proposed site.
Returns:
The corresponding site in tile newSite, or null if no corresponding site exists.

getSwitchMatrixSink

public Node getSwitchMatrixSink(Pin pin)
This will take a sink Pin from a design net and determine the final switch matrix and node or wire which the signal must be routed through in order to reach the sink pin.

Parameters:
pin - The sink pin to find a switch matrix for.
Returns:
A node (a unique tile and wire) of where the signal must be routed to reach the sink pin. Returns null, if none exists.

getSwitchMatrixTypes

public java.util.HashSet<TileType> getSwitchMatrixTypes()
This will return a set of all unique TileTypes which are considered to have a switch matrix or routing switch box in them.

Returns:
A set of all TileTypes which have a switch matrix in them.

getRows

public int getRows()
Gets and returns the number of rows of tiles in this device.

Returns:
the number of rows of tiles in the device.

getColumns

public int getColumns()
Gets and returns the number of columns of tiles in this device.

Returns:
the number of columns of tiles in the device.

getTiles

public Tile[][] getTiles()
Gets and returns this device's 2D array of tiles that define the layout of the FPGA.

Returns:
the tiles of this device.

getPartName

public java.lang.String getPartName()
Gets and return the partName (includes package but not speed grade) of this device (ex: xc4vfx12ff668).

Returns:
the partName The part name of this device.

getPrimitiveSites

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,PrimitiveSite> getPrimitiveSites()
Gets and returns the HashMap of name to primitive site mappings for this device.

Returns:
The map of name to primitive site mappings for this device.

getTileMap

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tile> getTileMap()
Gets and returns the HashMap of name to Tile mappings for this device.

Returns:
The tile mappings of name to Tile object for this device.

getRouteThroughMap

public java.util.HashMap<Wire,PIPRouteThrough> getRouteThroughMap()
Gets and returns the PIP route through map for this device.

Returns:
The mappings between wires and PIP route throughs.

getPrimitiveSiteIndex

public java.util.ArrayList<PrimitiveSite[]> getPrimitiveSiteIndex()
This method will get (create if null) a data structure which stores all of the device's primitive sites by type. To get all of the primitive sites of a particular type, use the PrimitiveType.ordinal() method to get the representative integer and use that value to index into the ArrayList. This will return an array of all primitive sites of that same type.

Returns:
The data structure which stores all of the primitive sites separated by type.

getAllPrimitiveSitesOfType

public PrimitiveSite[] getAllPrimitiveSitesOfType(PrimitiveType type)
This method will get all primitive sites with the same base type as that passed as a parameter type. This does not necessarily get all compatible sites for the PrimitiveType type as a SLICEL request would only return all SLICEL type sites and no SLICEM types which can also be a valid site for SLICELs.

Parameters:
type - The types of sites to retrieve.
Returns:
An array of primitive sites with the same Primitive type as type.

getAllSitesOfType

public PrimitiveSite[] getAllSitesOfType(PrimitiveType type)
Gets and returns an array of all primitive sites of the given primitive type.

Parameters:
type - The primitive type of the site to get.
Returns:
An array of all primitive sites in the device with primitive type type.

populateSinkPins

public void populateSinkPins(WireEnumerator we)
This method will iterate through all of the sink pins of the device and determine which switch matrix and wire node a routed path must pass through in order to arrive at the sink.

Parameters:
we - The corresponding wire enumerator for this device.

debugPoolCounts

public void debugPoolCounts()

writeDeviceToCompactFile

public boolean writeDeviceToCompactFile(java.lang.String fileName)
This function is used to write a compact version of the device to a file. The file can only be read by using the corresponding function readDeviceFromCompactFile().

Parameters:
fileName - Name of the file to create and store data for the device in the compact format
Returns:
True if operation is successful, false otherwise.

readDeviceFromCompactFile

public boolean readDeviceFromCompactFile(java.lang.String fileName)
This reads from the compact device file to populate all of the essential variables of this device. It can only be used to read files generated with the writeDeviceToCompactFile() method.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the compact device file
Returns:
True if operation was successful, false otherwise.

writeToDebugFile

public void writeToDebugFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                             WireEnumerator we)
This method is used only for debugging purposes.

Parameters:
fileName - Name of the debugging file.
